text: {{Infobox writer | name = Walter Abish | image = | birth_date = | birth_place = Vienna, Austria | death_date = | death_place = Manhattan, New York, U.S. | occupation = Author | awards = MacArthur Fellowship }} Walter Abish (December 24, 1931 â€“ May 28, 2022) was an Austrian-born American writer. He wrote many short-stories. He was awarded a MacArthur Fellowship in 1987. His best known works were Alphabetical Africa (1974) and How German Is It (1980). Abish died on May 28, 2022 at a hospital in New York City, aged 90. ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Writers from New York City Category:Writers from Vienna
title: Walter Abish
